poem:
"Shadow of Everyday"

Challenge of the mundane,
Stirs the dawn, lingering laze.
Late nights intertwine with sun,
Morning dawns at the stroke of eleven.
Hot milk, not scorched, teetering gentle,
Kind honeyed whispers on shredded grain.
Daughter Mary, echoing Sunday hymn,
Living room turned cathedral, resounding joy.
Domesticity, encapsulated wisdom,
Voiced not in sermons, but cereal.
At the bookends of the day,
What's shared in silence often speaks louder.
